name: Skydiver with arms in T-position
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing on the floor with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Position your torso so that you are leaning forward slightly, engaging your core and lower back muscles to maintain control throughout the exercise.
3. Bend your elbows at a 90-degree angle in front of you, keeping them close to your body. Place your hands at chest level with your fingers pointing forward and downwards.
4. Extend one leg behind you for balance support only, with your heel on the ground to prevent wobbling. This is optional step depending upon what makes it most comfortable to perform this exercise.
5. Straighten one arm above your shoulder to maintain good positioning of your upper body.
6. Hold the top position for a brief moment before slowly lowering yourself down by first bending the standing leg and then releasing the raised leg, while letting the arms hang straight down.
7. Pause briefly at the bottom position.
8. Step back up to the start position using both legs with control.
short_summary: Skydiver with arms in T-position is an upper body exercise that activates biceps, triceps and shoulders through controlled arm extensions above shoulder height while keeping your torso lean forward using core engagement.
